Important information

Ingredients
Deionized water, Dead Sea Mud, Kaolin, Shea Butter, Sunflower Oil, Aloe Vera Juice, Vegetable Glycerin, Jojoba Oil, Hickory Bark Extract, Calendula Oil, Xanthan Gum.

Directions
After thoroughly cleansing your face, apply a thin layer of mud mask avoiding the lip and eye areas. Leave mask on for 10-15 mins until dry. Use warm water in a circular motion to gently remove the mask. Pat dry with a clean cloth. For best results, use 1-2 times a week.

5.0 out of 5 starsLaboratory Tested and Personally Approved
ByC. HarringtonTOP 1000 REVIEWERon October 8, 2017
At first I was skeptical, especially given the low price point. My sole fear was that I would end up throwing money at a fancy jar of mud that came from someone's back yard. But after 2 months of use and a legitimate laboratory analysis I'm happy to say that sometimes you get more than what you pay for.

First and foremost: My wife is a Cell and Molecular Biologist for an Ivy League college and before writing this review I asked her to sample the mud for an analysis of ingredients, both out of personal interest and for review purposes. She showed me the report and the highest percentages are within sodium, chloride, magnesium, potassium, iron, and calcium - all of which nourish skin and enhance its ability to retain moisture.

Overall it took about four treatments to start noticing a lasting difference. Initially my pores looked smaller after the first application, but after a few hours my skin would revert back to the way it looked before. But gradually the results started lasting longer and longer. I can not offer any insight as to the effectiveness this has on acne since it is not an issue for me, but it sure does minimize pore size, crows feet, and other wrinkles commonly found on facial skin.

Best practices.

1. Do not use this mud mask consecutively. It is best to use it on Monday and Friday, otherwise it will absorb too much oil from your skin and leave it feeling/looking dry.

2. I personally warm the mud before applying it to my skin in order to ensure that my pores are open. Room temperature mud is still a little cold and will cause your pores to shut as soon as it touches your face.

3. Use a paint brush for application. You don't need a very thick layer in order for the mud to work, and the brush helps cut back on using wasteful amounts.
